channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging vegetation obstructing pavement, 21st September
item.description:
Overhanging vegetation is once again obstructing the pavement causing the pavement space, on the narrowest section of pavement, to be halved. People are having to stop and wait to let one another pass safely. Parents with prams as well as walking children are unable to have them walk at their side as they will get vegetation in their faces. This is a recurring issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 21st September
item.description:
The bins are overflowing outside every single shop and more than half of the pavements along Brecknock road are covered with commercial waste and rubbish. Boxes of rubbish from the shops are either crammed into the bins overflowing them, or stacked up messy next to the bin. There is even rubbish piled soo high and wide that it falls into the roads of Brecknock and drivers have to swerve around it into the next lane. There needs to be more rubbish collection and fines put into place for rubbish like this. It is a serious health hazard and health and safety issue. This needs to be addressed before There is a serious incident or a car crash.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Brecknock Road, Archway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven pavement, 20th September
item.description:
The pavement is upheved, you cannot cross it with a pram or a wheelchair. Elderly residents have tripped over this pavement. My own toddler has tripped over this pavement. It is a law suit waiting to happen against the council. This needs to be addressed and fixed as soon as possible. Because this has resulted in residents using the main road to walk in rather than the pavement. I saw a woman pushing her Elderly trolley in the road she could not risk the danger of that pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Middleton Mews, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 20th September
item.description:
On Haslemere Road at the junction with Long Lane, Bexleyheath: Please could you remove black graffiti from the white road name plate for Haslemere Road and from the top of a green street cabinet on the pavement as seen in the attached picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Haslemere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Lamp Out & central reservation crossing, 20th September
item.description:
Both the street lamp and the central reservation crossing lets are out, making the pathway down Watling Street impossible to see when dark. And that's not to mention to difficulty people are having with the paving/tarmac but the the tree roots that have left the pathway/walkway and extreme trip Hazard. Thank you in advance for you assistance/cooperation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watling Street, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge blocking pavement, 20th September

item.title: Fly tipping rubbish, 20th September
item.description:
I did report this last week but still waiting for this to be collected, the problem is from private landlords in simm road houses and not the flats. They are constantly dumping their rubbish and it’s done late at night, we are sick of this and to solve a problem would be a camera. As a tenant from 2 Beatrice Road gets her two friends to empty her four bins in to our recycle bins every week, for the past 2 years it needs to stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strathnairn Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contraflow bikelane desperately needed, 20th September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cottage Walk, Hackney, London

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwood Road, Hackney, London
